alert.note: Alert for Southern Fairfield; Southern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 12 at 4:21AM EST until January 13 at 3:00PM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of southern Connecticut and northeast New Jersey. In southeast New York, Rockland and Westchester counties. * WHEN...From this evening through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Area rivers, creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. Excessive runoff may also result in flooding of other low lying and flood prone locations. Coastal flooding may exacerbate impacts on tidal rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another deepening low will track up through the Great Lakes tonight, sending a strong frontal system through the area. Widespread rainfall of 1 to 2 inches is expected, with locally higher amounts possible. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in flood prone areas should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
